message.content:
{"id": "41347", 
"title": "Bug 41347CCombo fires defaultSelection on mouse list selection", 
"description": "Bug 41347CCombo fires defaultSelection on mouse list selection. A typical user of a combobox would be very surprised to have the dialog dismissed just because the entry was selected. This behavior should be changed. The current behavior makes it difficult to differentiate between selecting an entry using the mouse and hitting enter from the text field of the CCombo.", 
"OB": "The CCombo fires a defaultSelection event when an entry is selected using the mouse from the dropdown list.", 
"EB": "The CCombo should fire a selection event instead of defaultSelection when an entry is selected using the mouse from the dropdown list. Default selection should only occur when hitting enter from the text field. This will align the behavior of CCombo with standard Combos.", 
"SR": "To reproduce the issue, drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry using the mouse. The CCombo should fire a defaultSelection event, but standard Combos won't. This makes it difficult to distinguish between selecting an entry using the mouse and hitting enter from the text field of the CCombo."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '41347', 'title': "Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection", 'description': "Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection It shouldn't do this. A typical user of a combobox would be vert surprised to have thedialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected. ", 'OB': '', 'EB': "It shouldfire a selection instead.Default selection means something was selected and you should go and dosomething. The typical reaction is to process the selection and dismiss the dialog.A combo shouldn't fire default selection from just selecting an entry in thedropdown. Hittingenter from the text field should be treated as default selection. ", 'SR': "If you drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry usingthe mouse, the CCombo fires a defaultSelection. Standard Combos won'tdo this.Because of this you can't tell the difference between just selecting an entryusing the mouse and hitting enter from the text field of the CCombo. "}
